"Tonkotsu ramen has such a unique, creamy broth. The bamboo shoots, nori, corn, and soft eggs go so well paired with the broth and the meat. The meat just melts in your mouth, and some of the vegetables are kept somewhat crispy to make a dish with a lot going on in it."

USEFUL RECOMMENDATION?

"I've cooked this in a traditional oven, and it doesn't give the same result as a chicken roast, so a charcoal oven is necessary. Whether with wood or charcoal, the sensation of the embers and the smoke create a unique flavor on the chicken's skin. I recommend serving it with a fresh vegetable salad like sliced tomato, sliced gherkins, and shredded lettuce, accompanied by a balsamic vinaigrette. For the fries, I recommend thin fries seasoned only with salt (and maybe a little garlic powder). For the chicken, every chef has their own recipe; I recommend charcoal over wood, as the smoke from the logs overpowers the other flavors. Serve with mayonnaise, ketchup, salsa golf, and aji amarillo. For a drink, an Inka-Cola or fresh fruit juice. Best restaurant in Lima (top 15 best food cities): Granja Azul Best restaurant in Arequipa (top 96 best food cities): El Pollo Real If you're planning a feast featuring "Pollo a la brasa", I recommend the following dishes in the following order: Glass of water to open up space in your stomach and improve digestion. First Course: Escribano Second Course: Anticuchos Main Course: Pollo a la brasa Dessert: Strawberry or Passion Fruit Cheesecake"

1
